fields.description:
Oozie uses Hadoop Counters API, by invoking Counters.getGroup(). However, in
hadoop 23, org.apache.hadoop.mapred.Counters does not implement getGroup(). Its
parent class AbstractCounters implements it. This is different from hadoop20X.
As a result, Oozie compiled with either hadoop version does not work with the
other version.
A specific scenario, Oozie compiled with .23 and run against 205, does not
update job status owing to a Counters API exception.

Will explicit re-compilation against the relevant hadoop jars be required each
time? This will prevent launching a uniform Oozie version across different
clusters.
fields.summary: Hadoop Counters API limits Oozie's working across different hadoop versions

comments.body: This is also an issue for applications that were already running against 1.0 but will fail against 0.23. Though we dont have to support binary compatibility but a best effort would be good.

The problem is that MAPREDUCE-901 changed Counter and CounterGroup from abstract classes to interfaces, which is a binary incompatible change, and forces clients to recompile when moving between Hadoop 1.x and 0.23.

I listed some of the incompatibilities here: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HADOOP-7738?focusedCommentId=13163731#comment-13163731

While (in my case Oozie) code compiles and works fine with Hadoop 1 or Hadoop 0.23, the problem shows up when you compile Oozie using a version of Hadoop (i.e. 1.0.0) and then run Oozie with another version of Hadoop (ie 0.23/trunk).

*Compiled with Hadoop 1.0.0, run with Hadoop 0.24.0-SNAPSHOT:*

{code}
	at org.apache.oozie.action.hadoop.TestMapReduceActionExecutor.testStreaming(TestMapReduceActionExecutor.java:404)

testSetExecutionStats_when_user_has_specified_stats_write_TRUE(org.apache.oozie.action.hadoop.TestMapReduceActionExecutor)  Time elapsed: 31.487 sec  <<< ERROR!
java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: org.apache.hadoop.mapred.Counters.getGroup(Ljava/lang/String;)Lorg/apache/hadoop/mapred/Counters$Group;
	at org.apache.oozie.action.hadoop.LauncherMapper.hasIdSwap(LauncherMapper.java:273)
	at org.apache.oozie.action.hadoop.TestMapReduceActionExecutor.testSetExecutionStats_when_user_has_specified_stats_write_TRUE(TestMapReduceActionExecutor.java:488)
{code}

As Tom' mentioned earlier this is because Counters changed from abstract class to interface. Seems that the generated bytecode in Oozieland differs if Counters is an abstract class or an interface.

Because of this, I would this qualifies as an incompatible change in the Hadoop API.

IMO we should revert to the old Counters API i we want to maintain backwards compatibility here.

Else, downstream projects will have to either use shims or reflection if they want to be binary compatible.

This is preliminary patch. This actually works but changes the iterator api on Counters to be parametarized for groups with a Counters.Counter. 

I was able to run Oozie 3.1.0 (compiled against 0.20.205) jobs on a 0.23 cluster with this patch. Am trying to make the changes minimal so that the iterator is backwards compatible as well.
I should mention Oozie jobs (not just Oozie).
Updated on trunk patch. Reviews/Comments/Suggestions on how to fix this Counters issue in a better way are very welcome. I have run out of ideas (without code duplication) on how to do this.

To reinstate mapred API compatibility mapred.Counters.Counter and Group need to be changed back to classes. But this means that all the "mixin" code that was introduced in MAPREDUCE-901 will need to be reworked (e.g. FrameworkGroupImpl can't extend FrameworkCounterGroup and Group, if Group is now a class and not an interface). Rather than using inheritance to share code, I think it would be cleaner to make the old and new counters interfaces separate, and have converter code. This will make it easier to keep the old structure.

In fact I would say that we revert mapred.Counters to its pre-MAPREDUCE-901 state then re-implement it using the mapreduce.counters API.
Mahadev, would the following facade approach work? Seems a bit simpler. I've just tested it compiles.
take 2 for the facade approach, this time using a GenericCounter inside Counter as I've missed before this may be used in the server side.
This looks like a good approach. Counters.Group needs to be changed back in the same way. Also, Counters.Counter should not be static, since it isn't in 1.x.
take 3 making inner class Counter non static

I was wrong about making Counters.Counter non-static - it *is* static in 1.x (http://hadoop.apache.org/common/docs/r1.0.0/api/org/apache/hadoop/mapred/Counters.Counter.html). Sorry for the extra work Alejandro!

@Alejandro,
 I have a similar patch which tries to do something like this but I am running into some issues with it when I do the same thing with Group. Looks like some issue where the write fields doesnt match the readfields for TaskStatus (where Counters are used) and the tasks hang. Am still debugging that. After doing this for a couple of days, I am actually not averse to copying over the code to mapred.Counters :).

Why do you need to implement/use the read/write methods of the facade? I'd just make them throw UOEX. IMO the purpose of the facade is to keep the API compatible, I would not worry about the Writable part. I know it is a behavior change, but the fact that counters are writable should have not been part of the public API in the first place. Would this approach work?

Alejandro,
 mapred.Counters is actually used in the system and the serialization matters. Look at TaskStatus.java (Line: 471).
Running it through hudson!

@Mahadev, glad to help.

A few comments after browsing the patch:

* there is commented out code in the Counters class, it should be removed
* The name of the instance var 'realObject' seems to vague confusing, I'd suggest 'realGroup' (and the Counter 'counter' should be 'realCounter') 
* I assume that the Group iterator() will return Counters.Counter instances because that is what is in the groups, because fo the groupfactory. right? Else the iterator should have a wrapper that returns the Counter wrapper as elements.

PS: I find the mapreduce Counters stuff a bit too complicated (like why different group implementations), but that is not the scope of this JIRA.

  against trunk revision .

    -1 tests included.  The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
                        Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
                        Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    -1 javac.  The applied patch generated 532 javac compiler warnings (more than the trunk's current 530 warnings).

    +1 eclipse:eclipse.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    +1 findbugs.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

                  org.apache.hadoop.mapred.TestCounters

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Forgot to mention, tested the latest patch with Oozie compiled with 0.20.205 and was able to run jobs on Oozie successfully against 0.23. No Counter exceptions.

Looks like there is an existing race condition in Counters that is showing up with this patch. I am still hunting it down. TestJobCounters fails intermittently on trunk even without the patch.

I reviewed the patch for compatibility with Hadoop 1.x. I ran a SigTest compatibility test (like in HADOOP-7738) to see what the differences between the mapred counters are between 1.0.0 and trunk with this patch (see attached). Most are false positives due to the inheritance hierarchy changing. Here are the ones that I think need fixing:

* Counters.getGroupNames returns an Iterable<String> not a Collection<String> as it does in 1.x. I think we should change it back to return Collection<String> - we can always add a getGroupNamesIterable() later if needed.
* method public java.lang.String org.apache.hadoop.mapred.Counters.makeCompactString() is missing
* public static int org.apache.hadoop.mapred.Counters.MAX_COUNTER_LIMIT is missing (it's not used in 23, but we should still define it for compatibility)
Thanks for doing this Tom. Ill take care of those!

Arun was too quick for me to review  the patch :)

It looks good, only thing is that the  getUnderlaying*() methods for Counter & Group should be annotated as project private.
Thanks for pointing that out Alejandro. Ill make the change in the patch for MAPREDUCE-3822.
